c74object.name: bach.partition
c74object.description: Computes the integer partition of the incoming number or the partition of the incoming set

inlet.digest: The number or set to be partitioned
inlet.description: First inlet accepts a number or a set (llll) to be partitioned, depending on the value of the mode attribute

outlet.digest: Partitions of the number or set

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the result obtained from the most recently received input data.

method.name: int
method.description: If the mode attribute is set to 0 (integer), An integer number will trigger the computation of its integer partitions which are subsequently output through the outlet, each wrapped in a level of parentheses, and in decreasing lexicographical order.

method.name: llll
method.description: If the mode attribute is set to 1 (set), any llll in the second inlet is considered as the set to be partitioned. Partitions are then output from the outlet, each wrapped in a level of parenthesis.

attribute.name: distinct
attribute.description: If mode is 1 (Sets), this attribute toggles the ability to only output distinct partitions of a set (in case some elements are repeated inside the set).

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: If mode is 0, the partition is performed on integers; if mode is 1 the partition is performed on sets.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: Integer partition are often displayed in Young diagrams. The integer partition algorithm is inspired by the iterative algorithm exposed in http://jeromekelleher.net/generating-integer-partitions.html

entry.name: Inlet 1 (number/llll)
entry.description: The number or set to be partitioned. First inlet accepts a number or a set (llll) to be partitioned, depending on the value of the mode attribute

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Partitions of the number or set.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: Integer partition are often displayed in Young diagrams. The integer partition algorithm is inspired by the iterative algorithm exposed in http://jeromekelleher.net/generating-integer-partitions.html

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: compute, calculate, partition, number, young, diagram, set, subset.
